duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead and actively participate in pre/post award activities including go/no go, kickoff meetings, management reviews, fee-pro review, contract review, estimate/GMP review, contract negotiations.
Develop, document, and execute business strategy for the Geography.
Monitor safety results on all projects and, in collaboration with Safety Director, implement corrective actions when needed.
Drive and lead Employee Engagement and Retention for the Geography.
Leverage business insights by understanding industry trends, local market/economic conditions, and the business model to make critical decisions and create competitive advantage.
Rainmaker and responsible for identifying and secure new clients and drive client satisfaction.
Understand Competitive Intelligence and how to position the company within the Geography.
Serve as a Principal on key projects.
Model efforts for Cares, Inclusion, and Diversity, ESG and the company's Core Values.

education_certification.credential:
BS OR MS degree in Engineering or Construction Management
15+ years in the lead role on projects valued at $150 million or larger
Or equivalent combination of education and experience
